Faculty Evaluation Map Map m PLEASE READ! \n \n\n Offline inspection is a preparation for the areas that are not covered by internet connection or mobile data. \n\n All the inspection that you have done will not be directly available to the system. \n\n All the data you have done while conducting inspection is saved locally in your android device.\n\n Offline and online process are much likely the same but it have some minor adjustment for the offline process.\n\n Please with us if this offline process will have a lot of errors or flaws.
Mabini Colleges was founded in 1924 in Iriga,
Camarines Sur (now Iriga City) as Camarines Sur Institute by the late educator Miguel Rojo Ibana,
a native of Talisay, Camarines Norte. With an initial enrolent of only 12 students,
the founder and his students were aptly called “Mr. Ibana and his 12 disciples.”
From its humble beginnings, the school grew despite difficulties encountered. Through sheer determination,
perseverance and untold sacrifices, its triumph over the test and vicissitudes of time is considered a monumental
contribution of Mabini Colleges to the cause of education in Camarines Norte.
The Monroe Educational Survey Commission, which appraised the condition of private schools in 1928,
found most private schools all over the Philippines to be hopelessly substandard.
As a consequence, a vigorous purge of undesirable private schools was instituted which resulted in the closure of 38% of those schools.
Surviving this purge were only two private schools in the Bicol Region and one of them was the Camarines Sur Institute.
During the ensuing years, this school gained prestige as the biggest private school in the Region.
It also changed its name to Apolinario Mabini Institute as a fitting recognition to the ideals and virtues exemplified by
one of the greatest Filipino heroes and intellectuals admired by the founder.
The Monroe Educational Survey Commission, which appraised the condition of private schools in 1928,
found most private schools all over the Philippines to be hopelessly substandard.
As a consequence, a vigorous purge of undesirable private schools was instituted which resulted in the closure of 38% of those schools.
Surviving this purge were only two private schools in the Bicol Region and one of them was the Camarines Sur Institute.
During the ensuing years, this school gained prestige as the biggest private school in the Region.
It also changed its name to Apolinario Mabini Institute as a fitting recognition to the ideals and virtues exemplified by one of the greatest
Filipino heroes and intellectuals admired by the founder.
While this school in Iriga was at its zenith, World War II broke out and it did not spare the school from destruction.
Its building was ruined, its books burned, its equipment and facilities were looted that at the end of the war,
it had to start from scratch. Capitalization on its pre-war name, the school was preferred and patronized by students.
The incidental increase in enrolment brought many problems to the school.
But the founder in a brief period of two years was able to re-establish a higher standard of learning than many other private schools in the region.
By 1948, it was the leading private school in the Bicol Region.
The following year, despite the growing enrolment and prestige of the school in Iriga,
the late founder and his inspiring and self-sacrificing wife, Mrs. Flora Avila-Ibana, decided to transfer the school to Daet,
Camarines Norte in order to better serve their beloved province for the remaining years of their lives.
The future of Mabini Colleges is bright. It had gained the confidence and patronage of the people of Camarines Norte and the nearby provinces .
of Camarines Sur and Quezon.To date Mabini Colleges, in its own humble and sincere way, .
has been able to provide an efficient and dedicated service to carry on its mission of giving a decent and comparativel.
y high standard of instruction to the youth of Camarines Norte.
>
Mabini Colleges shall provide quality instruction, research and extension service program at all educational levels as its monumental contribution to national growth and development.
Specifically it transforms students into:
God-fearing,
nation-loving,
earth-caring,
law-abiding,
productive
and globally competitive graduates.
MC-CCS Faculty Evaluation is an android base application that will allow the students of Mabini Colleges to properly evaluate them with the use of their android device anywhere and anytime.
--Development Team

Discusses topics that are relevant to the subject> Motivates students to ask questions> Uses different teaching strategies to meet the learning needs of the students > Communicate effectively both in English and Filipino> Shares knowledge on the current trends and issues pf the object> Shows comprehensive and accurate knowledge of the subject matter> Integrates the subject matter into real life situations> Enriches class discussions with contemporary issues and events> Provides varied learning experiences for intellectual development>
Observes teachers code of ethic and the rules and regulations of the institution > Sets example of moral and ethical behavior> Guides every student to develop his potentials and capability to the utmost > Makes learning experiences of students enjoyable, fruitful and meaningful > Computes objectively the grades of the students> interacts with students to create positive classroom climate.> considers views and opinion of students> Takes part in school related activities> Identifies and responds to the learning needs of the students.>
You are to rate the faculty member using a scale of 1 - 5, where 5 is the highest. Please indicate the degree to which the following areas reflect his/her performance in the current semester
Rating: \n 1 - Unsatisfactory
2 - Below Average
3 - Average
4 - Above Average
5 - Outstanding

Prepares for the days learning activity. Starts and ends classes promptly. Administers tests effectively and announces the results of the tests. Provides stimulating atmosphere in the classrooms which encourages students to participate in class discussions. Determines the psychological needs of the students and adapt appropriate teaching styles. Provides student centered activities rather than teacher centered. Maintain discipline in the class. Makes herself available for consultation. Provides instructional materials relevant to topics. Leaves the room in the proper order.
Faculty Effectiveness Faculty Effectiveness Discuss topics that are relevant to the subject. Motivates students to ask questions. Uses different teaching strategies to meet the learning needs of the students. Communicates effectively both in English and Filipino. Shares knowledge on the current trends and issues of the subject. Shows comprehensive and accurate knowledge of the subject matter. Integrates the subject matter into real life situation. Relates lessons to existing conditions and real life situations. Enriches class discussions with contemporary issues and events. Provides varied learning experiences for intellectual development.
Professional Ethics and Personal Qualities Observes teachers code of ethics and the rules and regulations of the institution. Sets the example of moral and ethical behavior. Guides every student to develop his potentials and capability to the utmost. Makes learning experiences of students enjoyable, fruitful and meaningful. Computes objectively the grades of the students. Manifests interest in the progress of the student. Interacts with students to create a positive classroom climate. Considers views and opinions of students. Takes part in school related activities. Identifies and responds to the learning needs of the students.
You are to rate the faculty member using a scale of 1 - 5, where 5 is the highest. Please indicate the degree to which the following areas reflect his/her performance in the current semester.
Rating:
1 - Unsatisfactory
2 - Below Average
3 - Average
4 - Above Average
5 - Outstanding
Faculty evaluation is a process designed to improve faculty performance and assist in making personnel decisions. It is an important component of faculty development and personnel actions such as reappointment, grant of promotions, salary/rank. It is in the effective monitoring of performance that the faculty could be appraised as to them critical role as facilitators of learning. According to Grey (2011) implementation of effective faculty evaluation system CEL (Center for Educational Leadership)
\t Faculty evaluation is a process designed to improve faculty performance and assist in making personnel decisions. It is an important component of faculty development and personnel actions such as reappointment, grant of promotions, salary/rank. It is in the effective monitoring of performance that the faculty could be appraised as to them critical role as facilitators of learning. According to Grey (2011) implementation of effective faculty evaluation system CEL (Center for Educational Leadership) nationally recognized faculty, staff and consultants have expertise that supports school, district and state in strengthening instructional leadership to improve student learning. We believe that evaluation helps the teachers to expertise their profession to engage students in high quality learning while simultaneously increasing the expertise of school teachers in the improvement process.
